# Conflicts:
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/README.md
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/pom.xml
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/feature/feature.xml
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/amazonechocontrol/internal/AmazonEchoControlBindingConstants.java
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/amazonechocontrol/internal/AmazonEchoControlHandlerFactory.java
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/amazonechocontrol/internal/WebSocketConnection.java
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/amazonechocontrol/internal/discovery/AmazonEchoDiscovery.java
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/resources/ESH-INF/binding/binding.xml
#	bundles/org.openhab.binding.amazonechocontrol/src/main/resources/ESH-INF/thing/thing-types.xml

timeline.bodyText: Isn't ExtendedDiscoveryService deprecated?
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ah, just read your comment @J-N-K, so feel free to ignore my comment.
replies.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: What is the point of this using Function<String, HandlerBase>  values instead of Supplier<HandlerBase> values? None of the statically constructed values even use the String argument.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: This is highly inefficient, each iteration of the loop results in a fresh edit of the Thing and thus triggers a lot of events that could be avoided if you just called editThing once, removed all the unwanted channels from the builder, then called updateThing.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Same issue as I mentioned earlier.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: This log can be removed
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Is there a reason this was overriden?
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: This continue doesn't do anything, it can be removed.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Either change the name of this method or make it return a boolean instead.
timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Since this class isn't an osgi service I don't know if adding @Activate serves any purpose here.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Not sure either. It's the same in the "old" AmazonEchoDiscovery. Since it does no harm, I would suggest to leave  it here (since the discovery needs to be rewritten anyway).
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.author: cpmeister
cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: Is this code incomplete? It doesn't look like it does anything.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Agreed. I'm not sure if this was intended to enable the AccountServlet to provide more information (like it already does for the echo devices). I have added a field, so the mapping is kept and this can be extended later
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps you should increase/decrease by more than just a single percent. A change of a single percent is probably unnoticeable to the user so I think 10% is probably a better value.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Since according to the forum thread quite a bunch of users already use this enhancements (since month), I wouldprefer to keep it like this.
replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Also changed to int, as states are stored with int.
replies.author: J-N-K
